Description: Stump of a light brown, palm strip brush; constructed by tying narrow, palm strips into a bundle then turning whole over itself; the stump is divided into four branches; bound at the end where the strips are reversed by a 2 ply S palm fibre cord (dia. 5mm); cord is wrapped around 5 times then moves up diagonally to wrap the first branch and moves along to wrap the rest; the cord is tied around each branch two or three times with the end knots tucked into the brush so are unseen; the brush is very worn
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), N.W. bastion, unstratified, on slope to lake 311-?
